DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate efficacy safety Etodolac-lidocaine topical patch apply one time daily compare placebo treatment acute Delayed Onset Muscle Soreness ( DOMS ) upper limb .
DOC.brief_title: Etodolac-lidocaine Patch Subjects Experiencing Acute Delayed Onset Muscle Soreness
DOC.criteria: Have engage significant upper extremity fitness activity two time per week â‰¥ 2 consecutive week past 6 month prior screen . Subject body mass index 18 30 kg/m2 , inclusive . Subjects report pain movement score arm least 5 ( base 010 NRS ) secondary DOMS approximately 24 30 hour arm exercise . Presence another painful physical condition , opinion Investigator , may confound study assessment . Use pain medication ( include antiinflammatory drug ) prior Exercise Visit 72 hour randomization . Use corticosteroid ( oral , injectable , topical , inhale ) Exercise Visit randomization . Corticosteroids must wash least 3 day Exercise Visit . Chronic acute renal hepatic disorder , inflammatory bowel disease ( e.g. , Crohn 's disease ulcerative colitis ) significant coagulation defect . History allergy ( cutaneous systemic ) , asthma , hypersensitivity following : etodolac , lidocaine , paracetamol ( acetaminophen ) , acetylsalicylic acid , salicylic acid , NSAID , local anesthetic , know intolerance ( cutaneous systemic ) ingredient patch .
